page.title: 01INTRODUCTORY PAGE
page.content: Wherever one is in Bowes ,history is all around .Bowes village has the remains of a Roman fort ,a medieval castle ,a restored 12th century church and associations with Charles Dickens. Until 1982 ,the A66 trunk road ran through Bowes village ,bringing noise, dirt and danger .However ,with the building of the by-pass ,there is only local traffic to disturb the tranquility .The surrounding countryside is hilly semi-moorland supporting mainly stock farms .The village ,situated 4 miles west of the bustling market town of Barnard Castle ,has two shops ,a pub ,a garage and a village school.
